website_summaries.verdict: The Creative GigaWorks T40 is a good choice for those looking for larger than average size and sound in their PC speakers.
pros: Stylish mini-tallboy PC speaker with high-quality dual midrange drivers
easy access to volume, treble, and bass controls
cons: May be too tall for some tastes
rear power switch and overly bright power light mar an otherwise slick design

customer_reviews.title: Solid speakers with muddy bass.
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up after being really impressed with the Creative GigaWorks T20s I bought for my girlfriend's PC. While these T40s are louder and definitely have more punch in the low end, the overall audio profile is actually worse. It seems Creative wanted desperately to satisfy bass hungry teens with these, and the end result is a sound profile that's muddy and muted when compared to the crystal clear T20s. I'm keeping them ultimately as they serve my needs, but those who care about balanced audio and are in the market for desktop computer speakers should save themselves some money and just grab the T20s.
customer_reviews.author: Tango-Charlie

customer_reviews.title: NOT for computers !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Turns off within minutes of no detected audio, takes many seconds to wake up and misses the beginning of any sounds a computer makes. Sound quality is also poor compared to cheaper 3 points sound systems, even cheap $50 ones have way more Bass. You WILL be disappointed if you area gamer, media user, use for work and depend upon email chimes or just about any other computer usage. THESE ARE NOT IDEAL FOR COMPUTERS
customer_reviews.author: Bert O Burch

customer_reviews.title: Good set of desktop speakers
customer_reviews.text: Went from a 8 year old Bose Companion 2 series II to these. Although i feel these speakers are a upgrade over my previous Bose speakers nothing mind blowing going on with the creative T40's. The sound is warm, the Bass can give a decent thump (for the size) and the mids are clear but , still, not really blown away. Maybe my expectations were too high. With that said i think its safe to say these are the best 2.0 speakers on the market at the 100 dollar price point. Would highly recommend escpically if you are looking for a minor upgrade over the Bose Companion II. They looking really grill with the grill removed as well.
customer_reviews.author: charlie d

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Just what the doctor ordered! Love these speakers. My Altec Lansing with subwoofer setup finally quit on me. I had to get more external speakers other than the built-ins on my all-in-one. Read tons of reviews and studied youtube videos with my headphones that had comparisons and glad i did. These speakers aren't disappointing at all, in replacing my previous setup. I love music all kinds and these speakers make music great and take it to a higher level. I really love these speakers even the energy saver power-off feature. They also are great looking speakers standing on each side of my 24 in. all-in-one with the speaker covers on or off.
customer_reviews.author: Cobra455

customer_reviews.title: Ok overall, only good for saving space, pathetic bass output.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are replacing a refurbished Logitech Z625 (right channel suddenly died) and is missing a lot of content that was clearly audible with the Logitech speakers. The only thing these are good for is saving space or playing from a source with very little bass content. I wish I spent less money on a new pair of Logitech Z625 rather than this. The Z625 can fill a medium sized living room with more bass than you can comfortably speak over. Anyone care to trade?
customer_reviews.author: David Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: The sound is everything I was hoping for, thanks to the controls I can tweak the bass and treble to my liking. I like that the front protection covers are removable if desired to show the styled yellow speakers. A surprise was that I could hear the audio from both the back plug and the front aux if both are plugged in, this is great as I can have two sources running at the same time. A very pleasing surprise that means I don't have to use a mixing desk in the middle anywhere on my standard setup with both a PC and Mac as sources.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Witham

customer_reviews.title: 3 sets all of witch only lasted a lil longer then the 1 year warranty period
customer_reviews.text: tho at the price point they sounded good. they stopped working after ~18 months. i had three sets, none of them lasted. moving back to Logitech speakers. it also had a awful power saving feature that disabled the speakers for 10-15 seconds after power up or when audio was received. *edit* friend who got 1 of these from work when i replace them just died. thats number 4, and it lasted 19 or 20 months
customer_reviews.author: Timmy metal ferret man

customer_reviews.title: I’d recommend them
customer_reviews.text: Love the speakers, an ease to setup they just lack the punchy base, I know there’s no subwoofer but for 120 some dollars these speakers kick ass and don’t distort even at 85% volume. Well worth the price. Bose were my go to’s, but these sound crisp and more bass’y Than the Bose ever did!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron shoultz

customer_reviews.title: Clear, Balanced, Smooth, Detailed, No LOWS
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for more for this pair of speakers, especially considering the cost and size - granted I usually break in my speakers for a little while. I'm impressed with the volume, clarity and detail, and the smoothness of the tweeter. I'm not impressed with the low end, especially considering that for a few bucks more, my IK Multimedia iLoud MicroMonitors sound much better and provide much more low end with one three-inch speaker. Note that I'm not looking for the BOOM, rather tight, accurate low end. These speakers seem to cut off in the low-mids. Increasing the bass seems to increase muddiness instead. IMHO, money is better spent elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Vijay-Kumar Solanki

customer_reviews.title: When there isn't sound going through them they turn themselves off.
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't be a problem but paired with Windows 10 whenever they turn off Windows reassigns the sound output to any other available option even if its been disabled. So I constantly have to turn off my monitors built in speakers and re-enable these speakers. After weeks of dealing with this I have decided to toss there as they are not even that great sounding and not worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clarity Defined.
customer_reviews.text: These aren't for floor pounding bass. However, if you want to hear your music as it was actually meant to be heard, these are for you. Unbelievable clarity, very well rounded mids as well as buttery smooth bass. The finish is top notch as well as the build quality. I gave my father the previous version of these about 6 years ago, and he still loves them. I missed them and decided to spring for this model. These speakers remind you that there is far, far more to music than ear piercing highs and loud, boomy lows. From 1812 Overture to Primus, it all sounds fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: BigTuna

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound.
customer_reviews.text: These are a step down from the 5.1 speaker system I had but they sound pretty good. I had some trouble with one of the screws for the base of the left speaker but other than that they were easy to put together. The sound is nice but I'm one of those that likes to feel the base when the music has a lot of base but I just didn't want to deal with a subwoofer since I'm in a wheelchair and getting older so with a subwoofer I would have to get on the floor. These do have plenty of base.
customer_reviews.author: S.T.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers but now standby feature is awful.
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers with a lot of volume and great quality of sound. This is my second set after I gave my old speakers as a gift to a friend. Unfortunately it seems they've added a standby feature that is incredibly slow to turn back off. The old speakers had no issue but the standby festure makes the speakers take 20 seconds to turn on after auto shutting down. It makes you miss all your computer alerts and you have to restart music and videos if you want to hear the starting audio.
customer_reviews.author: M S

customer_reviews.title: Just OK.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of volume. Controls for treble, bass, and volume are nicely located. They look cool. However the sound has some definite drawbacks. Bass although quite loud is somewhat muddy sounding, more of a thump thump than the actual sound. Multiple sounds coming through the speakers all at once are also a bit muddy. Better than the Bose Companion II but no where close to Edifier speakers for $30.00 more.
customer_reviews.author: cutter

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product. Potentially devastating flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic everything. Except one little minor detail that SUCKS if you aren’t prepared for it. The line between the two speakers is about 2ft long. That means if you have a widescreen display, or want to use these for your tv, the speakers will have to be behind the display. At that point you won’t be able to access the controls. Fantastic product. Potentially devastating flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: You need these....
customer_reviews.text: after using basic little 10 watt speakers to listen to, i started to look for speakers that wouldn't break the bank and would deliver respectable sound. These kept popping up in my search, i read the review's and decided to give them a try. WOW! these so far give clear highs and a very nice low end ( i didn't need heavy base) as i have a 700 watt system for that. For the amount of Awesomeness these speakers give, i am very happy with this purchase. Recommended seller and product.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound! Dead after 4 Years.
customer_reviews.text: These are great sounding speakers with full, rich tone without a sub-woofer. Mine are SERIES ONE, I have been totally satisfied, Unfortunately they have just died after four years. I reluctantly bought another set because it seems that they provide the best bang for the buck but I won't expect them to last a long time. You can't get reliability at this price point. EDIT: Received my new T40's. I don't think you can get better sound in a 2.0 system than this.
customer_reviews.author: RZed

customer_reviews.title: Resume means missed sounds
customer_reviews.text: The product description says "Comes with a power-saving feature that puts the speaker on standby when audio is not detected, and wakes it up automatically when audio is played." There is a second or two delay when they restart so you will miss anything during that period. I get notification sounds for things like emails and CAN'T here them. They are not heard!!!
customer_reviews.author: JJChgo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound, works well with Amazon Echo Dot 2nd Generation
customer_reviews.text: I use these as bedside/nightstand speakers driven by an Amazon Echo Dot. The sound is fantastic, deep lows and crisp highs. The RCA cable between the two (hard wired to the right-hand speaker, male-plug to the left-hand speaker) is 60", but that's a bit short for a queen bed. An extension cable will be necessary to keep things neat. The speakers do go into standby mode after a short while, and waking Alexa first with 'Alexa are you there?' or something like that will help avoid missed content (like when you ask the time).
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Andrews

customer_reviews.title: OMG, soooo good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a sit down racing arcade machine I was building so I could get good doppler and good bass. Oh man they fill the entire large arcade room just like an expensive stereo system would. These things are freaking awesome for the money! I went right back online and bought a pair for my office computer which is in a small room. They sound amazing there too. Best stand alone speaker system I've had... probably ever. I do not see how you could be disappointed honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Quill

customer_reviews.title: Decent speakers for the money
customer_reviews.text: These are decent PC speakers. Easy to setup with accurate controls. Sound is fine. Not brilliant but good enough for the money. Nice feature is the front plugins for head phones and sound input. Gives you an option if you need to listen in private or at late night. Height gives a decent center on the screen when watching movies. Good for calls as well. Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Weld

customer_reviews.title: MF1616 versus MF1615 (European vs. non model)
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon page for this product show model number: 51MF1615AA002, which is also printed on the box. But the serial number sticker on the box shows: YMMF1616... and the model actually inside the box is an MF1616. This is the European version with the power savings feature, which is not what I wanted (see other review comments on this product for why this is undesirable). I had the same problem directly ordering this unit from Creative (fulfilled by Amazon). My guesses would be that Creative is either only manufacturing MF1616 now, or not concerned about which units go into MF1615 boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you are in the market for PC speakers these are the ones you should get.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several lower to mid level PC speakers and they have done the job for short times. I was fed up with the low durability of lower end speakers and having to throw them away after several months or perhaps a year or so. These creative speakers are well built, solid and most importantly sound excellent. The sound is not even close to speakers in the sub $50 range and the price difference in this case give you what you pay for and more. Excellent build quality and sound. For PC speakers, especially at this price this the ones you should get.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Bellman

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a must buy if your looking for great speakers. The volume is awesome nice clear and load. The Bass is outstanding and you would think you have a 2.1 system but you dont. Very happy with them. One thing to point out is they are very tall and heavy to just let you guys know.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Ultrasone) I was pretty blown away by her t20's when I first heard ...
customer_reviews.text: I had originally bought my ex the t20's based on overwhelmingly positive reviews, to accompany a computer build. Needless to say, coming from my thx 550's and assorted headphones (Sennheiser, Grado, Ultrasone) I was pretty blown away by her t20's when I first heard them. So impressed that when the amp in my thx 550's died, I didn't hesitate to pull the trigger on the t40's. While not having a subwoofer, and as a result do miss out on some of the lower frequencies, but they are quite flat and do actually have impressively accurate bass.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Decent Sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a secondary office. These are better than average. I returned them because there just was not enough sound after having a 5.1 system with a sub. I would have kept them had they had a sub out connection . Probably more than adequate for the average user.
customer_reviews.author: //// SPACEMAN ////

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good computer speakers, only caveat is that they turn off to save power
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good computer speakers, the only caveat is that they turn off to save power and it takes about 5 seconds for them to turn back on (which they do automatically) when they realize audio is coming in. There is NO WAY to turn off this feature, so I hope you like it! This isn't so bad for music (you'll miss the first 5 seconds, if you haven't played any sounds in 15-20 minutes, no big deal), but it can be annoying if you expect your computer to make a noise to inform you that (for example) a message / email has come in. On the plus side, it's more energy-efficient this way... I think!
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Good set of speakers for a PC.
customer_reviews.text: Good set of speakers for a PC. Quality product. If you need house vibrating bass, this one is not for you. It does have a decent base, and excellent sound qualities. Would buy again if I ever need mid to upper range, and a slightly subdued bass sound. I like them, money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Turn'em up!
customer_reviews.text: These replaced some very basic computer speakers so anything would sound better, however, I am quite impressed with the Gigaworks speakers. They look good, are packaged very well and of course most importantly have a very good sound. Nice adjustment knobs for bass and treble and the volume is illuminated. My brother has a pair of Klipsch (spelling?) speakers which are very good but to my non-audiophile ears these Gigaworks speakers perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Roger K.

customer_reviews.title: Bass frustrations.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for over a year and play through an outboard DAC. Lovely high mids and highs with a decent detail and just a bit of box coloration. But that bass. I have yet to hear a small speaker successfully integrating a pushed bass, and unfortunately this is no exception. There is that hole again between the mids and too often muddled, booming bass. I am finally replacing these with another set of the excellent Audioenging a 2.
customer_reviews.author: ItsMagick

customer_reviews.title: Best Speakers for the Money I Own
customer_reviews.text: I've had these speakers for about 6 years and I LOVE them. Paired with a pair of ATH-M50Xs, you won't get better affordable home computer sound. No need for a subwoofer, these things pack a mean bass wallop. My neighbors definitely hate them. Incredible speakers for the money. My turntable is running on some ~$100 Edifier speakers now, and I have that Vizio Soundbar that everyone raves about for my TV. That's better than these but also about 3x the price. The Edifier don't really stack up to these boys.
customer_reviews.author: Jared C.

customer_reviews.title: I didn't expect to notice much of a difference ( but am always looking for good sound). These are remarkable - the sound is ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to replace my old set of Bose desktop speakers. I didn't expect to notice much of a difference ( but am always looking for good sound). These are remarkable - the sound is great, and very noticeably better...and that is before they're broken in. So far I've been listening to jazz, W. African, Jorma Kaukonen, Dvorak. If I had known how great these would be, I would have bought them much sooner.
customer_reviews.author: colorado farmer

customer_reviews.title: I love their power.
customer_reviews.text: I love their power, and even more considering its a 2.0 system. Its bass quality is really, really nice. Sharps are a little dirt for my expectations, but nothing horrible. So far, Classic Jazz has been the best genere I've heard on them. If you love trash and metal, and noisy stuff, they'll get a bit "bad"noisier. In general they sound great below their half level. And believe.... at the half it's really, really high. Anyways, I like them. Happy customer (: In other hard, build quality is awesome. Also the packing work.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers for my fiancé, and we really liked them at first. They started out with great sound quality... but 6 months in they stopped working. We tried a different cord and did a bunch of troubleshooting, but all we could get out of them was a hiss on occasion. I gave them 3 stars because they were great while they worked!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Maddux

customer_reviews.title: Best sounding speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: For essentially a little over $100, these speakers sounds amazing with a wide soundstage and resolves well (for $100) with adequate bass. Some people say it's not loud enough, which may be so if you are trying to use them to light up a room at a party, but for computer speakers to be listened too 3-4 feet away, it's plenty loud. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Dinh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely thrilled with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely thrilled with the purchase. They are bigger than I expected, but can still lay down horizontally in front of my monitor as a viable option. The bass comes out of the top (not back, like some other brands), so when laid flat with the bass outputs facing each other, it gives a nice thump thru the middle without having it dominate the treble. If the cables could have angled plugs (especially the power, since In/Output right-angle cables can be purchased separately), then the Right speaker could fit more flush against a surface, but that's such a minor complaint, it's inconsequential in the grand scheme. Not having to reserve real estate or power for a Sub is a huge advantage.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: not a lot of power but nice sounding
customer_reviews.text: there a great looking speaker they sound great at medium volume defiantly lacking power if your reading the review about the lack of a low bass there right if your looking for high power a and lot of bass get the Logitech Z625 Powerful THX Sound 2.1 Speaker System....they kick ass for the same price but i will say the Creative GigaWorks T40 Series II sound better at low volume
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality and very durable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers 8 years ago and these are still playing top notch quality sound on my main PC after all these years. Never had any issues and not a single complaint. Sound quality is just amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Woo

customer_reviews.title: was wonderful ..until it died in just one month...teh wonderful again
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound...replaced a 5.1 full room surround sound set up (receiver plus polk speakers and a sony sub) due to space needs. The power block seem to be made cheeply...started hearing cracking sounds on the speakers...then noticed that power light on the the block was going up and and down when this happened...tonight it did it once and never came back...dead... no power...most likely really cheap connections....really liked the sound and space solution they had so going to return and get another pair and give it a last chance. Otherwise I would give it 4 or 5 stars. Update sep 2016 Replacement unit hasn't had any issues and I am happy with the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Basara's Voice

customer_reviews.title: Excellent PC Speakers. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are excellent. I have a semi-professional speaker setup and I am into music. These speakers perform well beyond their price point. They are excellent and really well built. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ali Al Raisi

customer_reviews.title: It's a joke
customer_reviews.text: Really can't understand all those positive reviews. They cannot produce any half decent sound at all. Actually it is difficult to expect any decent sound from 2.5 inch drivers. Do yourself a favor and buy that Chinese Edifier R1280t for 30$ less and enjoy ten times better sound. At least Edifier resemble real speakers sound.
customer_reviews.author: APM

customer_reviews.title: These speakers do the trick -- I'm happy with them
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these speakers for a couple months and am quite pleased. They pack a lot of power and I rarely go much past the one o'clock position on the volume control. Base and treble controls I keep pretty much at neutral, though good to have for problem audio source material. This was a worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: thamnosma

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful computer speakers - I use them with my new ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful computer speakers - I use them with my new Dell 7.1 system (I just plug them into the headphone jack and the sound is great ... good base, good voice, etc.). And one thing I REALLY like about them is that they turn off automatically (and turn on when sound is detected). WAY better sound/fidelity (and I have perfect pitch) than my previous Bose computer speakers ... better sound ... better price. No need for the clutter of extra speakers for my office. Creative (this is my second pair) knocked it out of the park!
customer_reviews.author: James E. Amos

customer_reviews.title: And they sound better the more you use them (speaker assemblies need time ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb "audiophile" quality multi-media speaker system. And they sound better the more you use them (speaker assemblies need time to break in - that's a fact of life). These sound absolutely wonderful - a very smooth sound with front to back depth and good imaging. And the funny thing is that I don't feel the need for a subwoofer because they are so well balanced. Glad I got 'em!
customer_reviews.author: Bernd W. Herrmann

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, and I like the tone control.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I wanted some control over treble/bass without having to buy a plug-in equalizer for Spotify or a new soundcard. These give me exactly what I needed. I like a bit more treble that what most music defaults to. The tone control works with the headphone output as well. I use a pair of 900mhz wireless headphones that lean toward the bass side, so this setup lets me compensate for that. I have no problem with the auto shutoff feature that some people are complaining about.
customer_reviews.author: Fair Witness

customer_reviews.title: Read & Heed
customer_reviews.text: Guess I’m a old head for bass is not what music is about kiddies. It is the overall sound (treble, midrange and bass) and how well they blend together. I have owned many PC speakers and outside the Soundsticks by Harmon, they are the best to me. Get all the different ranges plus loudness without distortion. Just my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Lan Da Man

customer_reviews.title: It is so annoying to always have to wait 3-4 seconds for sound ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give these 5 stars if they would just stay on constantly, rather than going into standby mode all the time. It is so annoying to always have to wait 3-4 seconds for sound to come out of the speakers. You always miss the first part of any videos or music. Other than that, great speakers. I really like the headphone jack on the front of the speakers, and that the volume knob adjusts the headphone volume too.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Wright

customer_reviews.title: Working great. Beats having to have a 2
customer_reviews.text: Working great.Beats having to have a 2.1, 5.1 or 7.1 and dealling with a subwoofer or a pile of cable mess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these speakers
customer_reviews.text: I love these speakers, the sound is fantastic, they are being used on my desktop computer and are fully automatic, come on when computer is activated and stay on as long as sound is being fed to them, as reported if no sound turn off in about fifteen minutes but come back on automatically as sound is reactivated. I often listen to Pandora radio when I am doing things on my computer and with these speakers listening to music is pure pleasure .
customer_reviews.author: Gerald King

customer_reviews.title: Audiophile speakers?!
customer_reviews.text: These seem to me to be a very good choice for anyone not wanting to be encumbered by the extra sub-woofer. They sound good and produce a respectable amount of pretty good bass. I have not compared them to other computer speaker systems, but I can say that when I listen to them as compared to my regular stereo (Polk satellites with Yamaha sub-woofer) they hold up pretty well. I am pleased with them. I have accidentally driven them up to a volume that I feared might damage them and they survived. They will give PLENTY of volume for anyone using their computer in a normal fashion.
customer_reviews.author: exrelayman

customer_reviews.title: Creative T40 Series Speakers
customer_reviews.text: First I would like say why I chose Creative T40's. Everything I have bought in the past from Creative has been an excellent choice. Sound cards, headsets. MP3 player all quality products. Creative GigaWorks T40 Series gets 5 stars. Quality sound, nice looking, and simple to setup. My old speakers are Creative I-Trigue 2200 and they small compared to the T40's. T40's are about 12.5" tall. 32 watts of power. I have no dislikes about Creative speakers..I would recommend these speakers to my friends and family.. Nice Job Creative. Fast shipping also.. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great Computer Speakers at this Budget
customer_reviews.text: Liked them so much that after a couple of year's use I bought another pair for another computer - full sound for a computer 2.0 set of speakers with a minimal footprint on the desk. Very clear midrange with nearly bedroom filling sound output. They have less bass than my M-Audio AV40 speakers with 5" woofer, but the bass is fair and they are half the size and half the cost. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 2.0 Powered Speaker Set
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked the sound and quality of Creative, so when it came time to upgrade my bedroom speakers, I researched these and a similar Bose set. I went ahead with the GigaWorks T40 Series II. I'm very happy with the purchase! These provide clear, room filling, wide range sound. The speakers themselves are nicely built and have an black cover on the front. The only thing that surprised me about them is that they were a bit bigger than I expected. However, I soon got used to their size, and they are doing just as well as I had hoped in terms of sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Keitheaux

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers with one big flaw
customer_reviews.text: Overall these speakers are pretty good, but there is a power save feature that cannot be disabled that turns the speakers off after a few minutes of not being used, and takes up to five seconds for the speakers to start working again after playing sound. It is horribly annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Much better than I expected. They sound very crisp and clear for computer desktop speakers. I like that there is a headphones "in" port on the front and you can control the volume via the speakers themselves. I listen to hard rock/Industrial (NIN, Korn,Godsmack etc) and these sound great. I do wish I could add a sub though. The base is great on it's own, but it doesn't have that punch I am looking for when I crank it up in the office when I'm alone. However the clarity and vibrance of the audio makes up for that. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Al

customer_reviews.title: Don't like the standby mode.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these for approximatley 6 months now. Outstanding performance and sound! Performs well with anything from classical music to movies to bass heavy techno. These speakers have an excellent kick to them. The only thing I don't like is that they go into "standby mode" after a 10 min period of silence. This means that the next time you play something, it takes ~3 seconds before the sound is produced. Because of this, some notifications are unheard and you may miss the few few seconds of a video. Wish there was a way to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Great desktop sound
customer_reviews.text: I Previously had the T20 series from creative, and was very pleased with them. Switching to the T40 is just a lot more of the same goodness. The soundstage and stereo seperation are excellent, increased level of volume without any distortion (these go to 11), and the same rich and deep sound that characterized the T20's is evident here as well. A couple of extra features are the more mild blue-led indicating the system is on, and auto-shutdown/auto-power feature when the system detects audio or not are nice additions. Overall a great set for anyone looking a desktop stereo speaker set for his PC.
customer_reviews.author: Lior Boogtus

customer_reviews.title: Nice speakers for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice little speakers...I don't really like to play music really loud but these are get pretty loud. Enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Clifton

customer_reviews.title: For the price you may actually be better off getting a 5 piece set like the Logitech ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price you may actually be better off getting a 5 piece set like the Logitech z506 and just not connect the center, back speakers (if you don't want to spend a tiny amount on the extra conversion cords needed for a non-surround card) so you get the extra base from the sub. Sure the sound that does come out of these two speakers are good quality, it just doesn't have the base to make it worth the price when you can get so much more out of similarly priced speakers.
customer_reviews.author: RKDJ

customer_reviews.title: Great 2.0 Computer Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Great sound! Very clear/clean sound! Looks great! Fair price for what you get. -Highs are great -Mids are great -Bass is great -Deep bass is just OK I am very happy with this purchase and I would buy them again without question. The only way to get great deep bass is with a sub-woofer. You can always add a sub-woofer later if you want. I added an old sub-woofer, then removed it as the sub added too many wires and took up to much space for my setup. (my sound card has an sub-woofer out port)
customer_reviews.author: C. Villwock

customer_reviews.title: Boomy and low end drops off. Soundstage is great.
customer_reviews.text: Imaging is great, sound quality is generally super. But, and a huge BUT, they are way, way too boomy (with default Bass/Treble knobs) in the 150Hz range. WIth plastic enclosures, this frequency range seems to resonate the cabinets. An EQ adjustment can flatten the response out (don't have it on mac unless using iTunes or installing Boom app ($). After EQ, bass is pretty flat until about 80Hz then totally drops out... probably a -18dB/oct drop and the EQ can't solve that- the speakers will destroy themselves. Also note: VERY TALL.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Best speakers i have ever had!
customer_reviews.text: These sound Great! they were easy to set up and look nice as well:) Best speakers i have ever had!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Solid and really good sound
customer_reviews.text: I was a little surprised at how light these speakers are, but i'm very happy with the sound quality and finished. I can't find anything to complain about cause I'm too busy listening to music and movies. I'm very please with this speakers
customer_reviews.author: vincent

customer_reviews.title: I love them
customer_reviews.text: I simply couldnt be happier they have saved me space on my desk, i had an old bulky 5.1 set with a sub woofer sitting on my desk since i've been customizing my PC and had to get a bigger case i ran out of space. I saw these and wanted to get them. After using them they are loud very loud, the base is great, however my 5.1 with a sub woofer had more thump, but its to be expected. the quality is great, the build and sound quality a great. i feel they are worth the money for me but i think the smaller set would have done just fine, i would recommend these to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Sonia/Leo H.

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Good to Me
customer_reviews.text: The Creative GigaWorks T40 Series II 2.0 speakers were a pleasant surprise. I debated purchasing speakers from Bose on the "Can't Go Wrong" theory, but I thought that I would give them a try. The only things that I would change would be to add a balance control and to improve the knobs. The bass is decent, but not great. Fortunately the midrange and treble are quite good; the lack of extended bass is OK because I really do not want to shake the walls or windows. I am quite pleased with the speakers and their fine, detailed sound.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: I use these speakers twice a week to teach a Music Appreciation class. Suddenly, all they do is click, no sound. My brother has the same brand that has lasted so far 15 years. These lasted less than 2.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Mary F. Keating

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, decent price
customer_reviews.text: I now own two sets of these speakers. Great product with great sound. If I had a complaint, it would be the delay in the speakers coming out of sleep mode before you can hear sound again. Over the years, I have adjusted to this, but if they came out with a newer model that had less of a delay or at least a way to customize how long before the speakers went to sleep, I'd gladly pay for new speakers again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: I do not pump the volume up. It's usually kept right around 50%. The bass is almost non-existent. If I try turning the bass up, it makes the sound more grainy. The speakers do not support the hz range well, as I can regularly pinpoint gain and distortion where there should be none, as well as the occasional all-out static. Pretty disappointed in these, and wish it weren't too late to get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip A. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: No longevity
customer_reviews.text: These only lasted 2 years; now I get intermittent but persistent droning and the left speaker's audio quality is now garbage. Booooo.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hale

customer_reviews.title: Decent Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a dead Bose Companion II system. I can't tell the difference in sound quality over the Bose. And these were half the cost of the Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: These speakers sound amazing. They sound more like bookshelf speakers than computer speakers. I haven't yet had a problem with them turning off automatically. The only issue is the cord that attaches the 2 speakers is only about 4 feet long which is great for a computer, not so great if you want one on each night stand or separating them for sound.
customer_reviews.author: tim a patelzick

customer_reviews.title: Clean P.C. or laptop speakers 🔊.
customer_reviews.text: Nice set up for pc or laptop 💻 easy to set up and nice 👍🏻 sounding. I’ll shut off automatically the speakers after you shut down computer and turn back on when you turn on computer.
customer_reviews.author: Aturservice2

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up to my audio out on my Samsumg Led 46" tv, and it works great. I use it for the headphone feature which allows me to turn the volume on the tv to 0 when I want to. I don't mute the tv speakers because you see that annoying mute symbol on the screen. When we have the tv speakers and these speakers on at the same time, the sound we get is much richer than we had before. We might get a soundbar for this tv which is in the living room, and move these speakers into the bedroom. I only wish these came with a remote to control the volume remotely.
customer_reviews.author: Moe Money

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound for a 2.0
customer_reviews.text: I had an old 2.1 creative speaker set that I recently decided to replace. I went with these because I love creative for their speakers even after owning some logitech ones. These speakers are actually pretty large and if you're looking for something compact I might recommend getting something a little smaller. Pros: Great sound quality with surprisingly good bass Similar sound as a standard 2.1 set Power off/ Standby for when you don't have sound running to the speakers Great design Cons: A little bit bigger than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Alex kent

customer_reviews.title: Nice Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a faulty Logitech 5.1 speaker system with the GigaWorks T40. I was worried that switching from 5.1 to 2.0 would be a setback but i am very happy so far. PROS Sound is powerful and clear, speakers look great wherever you put them. I am using them as desktop speakers but this can fill with music any room in my house. Frontal controls do the job easily (Bass, Treble, Volume, Headphones and Aux In) CONS Not really a con but if i must list one maybe it is the size, they are kinda big, not a problem for me. Just check for size if you care.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound
customer_reviews.text: Crisp, clean highs, accurate midrange and surprisingly thunderous bass in a small footprint. Now, these are small speakers, so don't expect them to replace 12" woofers. But for an addition to a laptop or desktop computer or your MP3 player, this system will give you more than you'd expect. I prefer a 2-piece system like this one because the sound doesn't seem disjointed as systems with a separate subwoofer do. Take care though, as the fabric on the removable screens is easily torn.
customer_reviews.author: An Average Guy

customer_reviews.title: I have had these speakers for about 5 years. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had these speakers for about 5 years. They are a steal at the price. They are so much louder and crisper than you would expect for the price. I actually turn the bass dial DOWN because it is so robust. If you are considering speakers for a home computer or audio system to play music from in a large apartment, stop now, these are the ones for you. Few things in life exceed expectations: LL Bean waterproof boots and these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No subwoofer, means I'm happy
customer_reviews.text: Quality design, quality sound (decent bass for the size of the speakers), and no subwoofer means easier to move around a room without as much tangled wiring. You still may need a subwoofer if you want really loudddd bass, but I'm too lazy to lug a subwoofer from apartment to apartment. This is good enough for me, since they DO respond well in Mid's and low mid's range before dB falloff. Would recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is great. I ordered it to work with my Big ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great. I ordered it to work with my Big Mac, but there were no instructions as to how to get the computer's sound to shut off and let the GigaWorks system come through. Also seemed to be missing a connecting chord, but it hooks up all right with my iPod. Also, when asked for the serial number for the warranty, or to even report a problem--there is no obvious indication as to where to find that number. Perhaps all my problems stem from being an amateur. Glad I could figure out how to get it put together and set up; happy with the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Swartz

customer_reviews.title: ... this item about the numerous user review of the annoying power-saving feature of the T40 II EUR version 1616 ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been contemplating on purchasing this item about the numerous user review of the annoying power-saving feature of the T40 II EUR version 1616 which is what amazon delivered to several consumers. Last week, I finally convinced myself not to bother with that feature so I ordered one. I received a EUR version 1616 too (as indicated by the sticker with serial print). I've heard this speaker several times from a friend, and I definitely love the sound signature. Definitely worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Zulueta

customer_reviews.title: More for the money
customer_reviews.text: No complaints, glad I went with these over the Bose. Creative does a nice job for low end fidelity, no complaints and very overdue.
customer_reviews.author: A. Erganbright

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Speakers!
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are great! Great sound, easy to setup. I do not have any problem with the sleep/wake mode, since I know that it takes seconds to have them on and I do not have to worry to turn them off, very convenient. The quality of sound and the good they look compensates for that little glitch.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I already had a sub woofer and decent pair of speakers, but I wanted more volume. These speakers were my solution. I like that they have separate bass and treble knobs. The treble range is great and there's no need for me to turn the volume all the way up. They are bigger than I expected but they look pretty sleek. This is my fourth speaker purchase from Amazon, buying better quality each time, and these are in another league. But, as usual, if you want booming bass you're going to need a sub woofer. They were $99 when I purchased 2 weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: city dweller

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Speaker highs are pretty good. Sound desperation is equal the only thing I would add is it does need a little more punch in the base. They are exactly worth their price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent out of box, excellent with sound card
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are better than most and will sound great to the untrained ear, but not to an audiophile (unless you have a good sound card). By themselves, they are decent but the main benefit is that whatever your sound card pumps out, they will output. Some speaker brands have their own modifications so they'll sound pretty much the same regardless of whether you have them hooked to sound card or not, but the difference is big with these.
customer_reviews.author: Home Theater Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Creative GigaWorks T40 Series II 2.0
customer_reviews.text: these are absolutely marvelous!...great price...outstanding sound...i use mine as part of a Kitchen setup for my wife...hooked-up to a Samsung 22in HDTV & Sony Blu-Ray...the sound in a small area, such as a kitchen, is superb!...and in case you are wondering the Base response is is good enough that you have to back it off a bit from Medium...highly recommended (your wife will love them...and you)...jo'c
customer_reviews.author: John M. O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pair of computer speakers. They are all I was hoping they'd be. I haven't had any problem with the sleep mode many have been complaining about. Of course these speakers wont blow out any windows, but totally worth every penny. They do blow away my Bose that they have replaced though. Love these! Keep checking the price though, as it changes frequently. I paid $81.00 but have seen them drop to $69.00. I will definitely buy another pair for my husbands computer.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: impressed~
customer_reviews.text: I use logitech, creative, bose PC speakers, this is the best and highly recommended~
customer_reviews.author: Happy Analyzer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Speakers
customer_reviews.text: These things sound awesome! Pros: Great sound, sleek look, quality speakers Cons: original cord to connect them wasn't long enough to fit around my three monitor setup, picked up a 10ft extension for less than five dollars though, so I can't complain too much! All around good speakers for just about any environment, I would easily recommend these to anyone looking for a good set of computer speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B.

customer_reviews.title: IF ONLY THEY WOULD USE A SUB !!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal speakers from the get go !!! I build home audio speakers using some of the worlds finest drivers made. These speakers although plastic - albeit solid hard compressed - are absolutely outstanding solo speakers. If Creative would build a sub respective of the quality of these two T40 Series II channel speakers this set would be one of the finest 2.1 computer sets on the market, bar none ! The two speakers by themselves are amazing. Beautiful clarity from one end of the frequency spectrum to the other. Finish front and back is top quality. Please Creative Gigaworks make a sub to accommodate these speakers !!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Waddell

customer_reviews.title: Not very good performance
customer_reviews.text: Although they are good looking speakers, that is where the good review stops. The volume needs to be at 1/2 just to start hearing sound and to get any real volume you are at full volume and still not that loud. The bass is basically non-existent. Not worth the price and I would encourage potential buyers to look at something else.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Very good speakers
customer_reviews.text: These are big for computer speakers, but not so big as to be in the way. Great sound quality. My only gripe is that the auto standby feature is not adjustable. If this were adjustable or optional, these would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Skribs

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers, good sound/bass, cheaper than Bose!
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are great for how I'm using them at work. I QC media and do remote A/V sweeps using FOSCAM's, so sound range and bass depth are important aspects of speakers. I was pleasantly surprised by the great treble and bass coming from these speakers. I paid $10 less than the comparable Bose set and I'm happy with my purchase. My only gripe would be that I wish the wire ports were on the opposite speaker based on how my desk is set up.
customer_reviews.author: Carson Cook

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound from high quality speakers
customer_reviews.text: These two speakers produce a sound that envelopes you as if you had a full 5.1 setup. Vocals come through crystal clear, making them perfect for watching movies. I purchased these speakers to replace a Dell soundbar that fits beneath my monitor, and I'm amazing at the improvement in sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewed by John

customer_reviews.title: These Sound Great
customer_reviews.text: These are everything I could have hoped for and more. My mini stereo that I had in my computer room finally bit the dust. So I tried listening to music through my computer speakers, it was horrible. After a couple months of no music I thought instead of buying a new stereo why not try just getting new computer speakers. I was more than surprised at the quality of sound! I really didn't think I would ever find "computer" speakers of this caliber. These are truly awesome!
customer_reviews.author: lovevintagejewels

customer_reviews.title: Love these speakers
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy a more expensive set of speakers after getting sick of cheaper speakers sound and them dying so often. These are perfect for me. They angle nicely and are tall which helps the sweet spot for the sound a lot. Also there is a aux and headphone input up front which makes them perfect for quickly switching to headphones. The sound is great and the volume is amazing I could use them for a party if I really wanted to, that's how loud and good they can get.
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: 1- Insufficient Treble range (No highs). 2- The auto ...
customer_reviews.text: 1- Insufficient Treble range (No highs). 2- The auto shut-off (Power save) function cannot be disabled. when it is in auto shut-off mode, the first couple of seconds of audio are lost. These are intended to be computer speakers, where notification tones are important. These notifications are completely wiped out with the auto shut off function!
customer_reviews.author: SAMI SHOSHARA

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: read a review to pair these up with my macbook (everyone always complaining they can hear movies on my computer and i refuse to get a tv). anyway these things are just great, and i got a good deal of $99 for these. i waited a good 4 years to get a nice pair of speakers and this is definitely it. recommended for mac laptops. now they can be better entertained bcuz it isnt some weak sound coming from my laptop viewings. easy to assemble although some might prefer to put them on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy C

customer_reviews.title: Sure these are big enough but what a sound
customer_reviews.text: I had Logitech Z4 for 5 years - was OK but when they broke I decided to try something different. I am considering myself an audiophile (turntables is the only way to go!) so I wanted a decent quality even from my computer. All I can say - these are great. Definitely take more space than your average Logitech but sound is simply incomparable. Bass is fine - tried "Something in the way" - sounds very clear; much better than Logitech's Z4 subwoofer; highs and middle are perfect. Separation to channels is excellent. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers without the hype
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased and now own two sets of these speakers. I chose these because I want good quality of sound for music without the booming base to destroy my hearing. They work perfect for what they are supposed to do and don't come with the premium price tag of other over-marketed speaker systems.
customer_reviews.author: S. Chang

product_meta.title: Creative GigaWorks T40 Series II 2.0 Desktop Multimedia Speaker System with BasXPort Technology
product_meta.description: Fill your room with vibrant audio from the GigaWorks T40 Series II speakers, the enhanced model of the award-winning GigaWorksT40.The GigaWorks T40 Series II propels audio enjoyment into the next level of acoustic fidelity. There's no need for a physical subwoofer as the three-driver Midrange-Tweeter-Midrange (MTM) audiophile configuration comes with BasXPort technology - delivering excellent dynamics with rich extended bass. While the silk dome tweeter with dual woven glass fiber drivers produces crystal clear highs with full range audio, the whole system also offers an improved power output of 16W RMS per satellite.With a refreshing design and style, the GigaWorks T40 Series II is set to be a perfect addition to any living room or desktop.
feature_bullets: Refer the user manual below for troubleshooting
BasXPort technology enhances the low frequency response without the bulkiness of a subwoofer. Convenient front access to volume, bass, treble and input jacks.
Connects to your computer, MP3 player, LCD TV or other stereo audio sources.
Comes with a power-saving feature that puts the speaker on standby when audio is not detected, and wakes it up automatically when audio is played.
